As a UI/UX Designer at FBS, you will play a critical role in creating and implementing our design vision across desktop and mobile products. You’ll collaborate with a talented product team—including Product Management, Data Analytics, and User Research—to drive the design process from concept to implementation. Your work will directly impact user satisfaction, engagement, and overall business success by ensuring seamless, user-friendly experiences.
Responsibilities
Design Solutions & Library Systems
Create and deliver ideas, concepts, and designs aligned with business goals and user needs.
Develop and present prototypes using the most effective methods for the project.
Apply insights from User Research, Data Analytics, and Competitive Analysis to inform design choices.
Clearly document design details to facilitate collaboration with developers and stakeholders.
Maintain and contribute to the UI Library for future development.
Work closely with product and development teams to ensure designs are feasible and implemented correctly.
Collaboration & Strategy
Partner with product and development leaders to align designs with technical requirements.
Follow FBS design team standards for naming conventions and file organization.
Work closely with stakeholders, including senior management, to ensure design strategies support business goals.
Effectively communicate design plans and concepts to internal and external teams.
User-Centered Approach
Conduct and integrate user research to understand behaviors, pain points, and motivations.
Stay updated on industry trends, UX best practices, and emerging technologies.
Prioritize usability testing and iterate based on feedback to enhance product experiences.

What You Bring
5+ years of SaaS product design systems experience (real estate/MLS industry experience preferred).
A strong portfolio showcasing SaaS work and design solutions.
Expert proficiency in Figma for prototyping and design collaboration.
Experience working alongside product managers, researchers, and developers.
Ability to balance customer needs, business objectives, and existing product frameworks.
Knowledge of HTML/CSS for effective collaboration with development teams.
Familiarity with Nielsen’s 10 Usability Heuristics and their application in UX design.
Basic understanding of real estate transactions and terms, with a willingness to learn more.
What Makes You a Great Fit
Highly organized with strong attention to detail.
A collaborative mindset—you thrive in teamwork but can also work independently.
Excellent communication skills, able to articulate design decisions clearly.
Adaptability—able to innovate while respecting existing design structures.
Passionate about user-centered design and continuous learning.
Join us at FBS, where you’ll help shape the future of real estate technology with intuitive and impactful design solutions!
Hiring Range: $121,000-150,000 per year (based on 2,080 hours), depending on experience.

Pearson : Senior UX/UI Designer
Location: Remote
Pearson
Pearson is a design-centric product company whose mission is to have a direct relationship with millions of lifelong learners. As the the world’s learning company with more than 20,000 employees operating in 70 countries, we provide content, assessment, and digital services to learners, educational institutions, employers, governments and other partners globally. We are committed to helping equip learners with the skills they need to enhance their world of opportunities. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.
Senior UX Designer
We are looking for a Senior UX Designer with a portfolio rich in engaging marketing and eCommerce solutions, complemented by a process effectively communicated through presentation and storytelling.
Key Accountabilities
Driving Design Excellence: By performing research, journey mapping, wireframing, and crafting high-fidelity design solutions.
Prototyping and Validation: Take charge of designing and presenting high-fidelity solutions, and/or prototypes for validation and feedback, ensuring a robust and user-centric approach.
Smooth Hand-off and Oversight: Transition validated designs seamlessly to development teams, overseeing the implementation phase for alignment with the envisioned design.
Mentorship and Leadership: Informally guide and mentor junior designers, sharing best practices, processes, and methodologies to help support their growth.
Research: Experience leading and facilitating design research, design sprints & ideation sessions.
User Advocacy and Quality Assurance: Champion user needs throughout the design process, consistently advocating for high-quality, user-centric solutions.
Collaborative Integration: Collaborate actively with your design peers to ensure seamless integration of your work within our broader ecosystem.
Exceptional Skills: Demonstrate excellent communication, self-management, organizational, and presentation skills to effectively convey and advocate for design concepts.
Positive Collaborator: Embrace a highly collaborative nature, fostering a positive mindset that contributes to a dynamic team environment.
Who are you?
Minimum of 6 years' experience in a Senior Individual Contributor role.
Very hands-on: A Senior-level thinker who is exceptionally fast with Figma.
Excitement: Driven to create something exceptional.
Attention to detail: Ability to balance accuracy and efficiency.
Experience working autonomously and leading independent initiatives.
Strong design point-of-view and comfort challenging personal opinions.
Ability to translate conceptual thinking into tangible design solutions.
Effective communication of ideas and design decisions.
Craftsperson: Strong skills in UX/UI, proficient in Figma and design prototyping tools.
Experience in marketing and eCommerce experience design.
Experience contributing to established design systems/design language.
Experience collaborating directly with engineers and product managers in a fast-paced environment.
We're excited to hear from candidates of all experience levels! Don't worry if you don't tick every box—some of our best fits surprise us. Send in your application, and let our recruiters work their magic!
The salary for this full-time role falls between $110,000 and $130,000, based on experience and qualifications

At Pearson, our purpose is simple: to help people realize the life they imagine through learning. We believe that every learning opportunity is a chance for a personal breakthrough. We are the world's lifelong learning company. For us, learning isn't just what we do. It's who we are. To learn more: We are Pearson.
Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities.
If you are an individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career site as a result of your disability, you may request reasonable accommodations by emailing TalentExperienceGlobalTeam@grp.pearson.com.

Description

Medium has a long history of strong design leadership. As we enter a new phase of innovation we will be shaping the future of social publishing for our millions of readers and writers.

At Medium, our mission is to deepen understanding across across the world by building community around shared stories and we invite you to join us. We are looking for a Principal Designer who is passionate about this mission and can bring exceptional craft and fresh insights to the world of reading, writing, and publishing. You’ll help drive and execute an ambitious product design strategy, contributing at both the structural and granular levels that shape our product experiences. If you are hungry for that type of hands-on impact and you are eager to lead, learn, and grow, we’d love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

As a key leader in the product design team (currently a small team of four product designers and one researcher), you’ll report to and partner with the Head of Design to shape and enable a culture of excellence. You’ll design world-class experiences alongside engineers, leadership, research, and other designers by exploring and developing ideas and connecting them to business objectives. You will also work closely with our Content and Data teams to bring your ideas to life and to understand the impact of your work. Your influence across projects from start to finish will help shape our most complex, interconnected systems as well as our most delightful customer facing features.
Medium is an environment where designers and engineers are empowered to make good ideas happen. As a senior team member, you will need a deep understanding of our product and a commitment to delivering high quality work. You’re most likely to succeed in this role if you have a mind for business and strategy as well as a love for building and shipping impactful, delightful experiences.

Finally, we take our team culture seriously. You’d be a great fit for this team if you appreciate a high bar for both execution and culture: you are great at what you do, and you’re humble about it, eager to mentor and coach the team around you. We are highly collaborative and looking for someone who is ready to roll up their sleeves and jump right in.

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

8+ years designing consumer-facing software
Experience working on social or reading and writing platforms, or in similar industries
Track record of driving complex systems design at scale
Experience shipping, scaling and maintaining design systems
Ability to navigate urgency and ambiguity with a multi-faceted team in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrated industry influence; we’d like to see examples of how you think outside the box and build enthusiasm for your ideas
A genuine interest in Medium’s mission and knowledge of our platform
Excellent design sensibilities and instincts that translate well to your UX/UI execution
Informed product design opinions and industry knowledge that reflect current trends
Strong desire for product impact through your designs
Prototyping in Figma or code
Bias toward action; you are outcome-oriented and take responsibility for your impact
You demonstrate good judgment and can balance autonomy with collaboration
Comfort navigating data, from UX metrics to qualitative and quantitative inputs
Strong communication and presentation skills; you can easily relay the “why” behind your work as well as the “what” and “how”
You enjoy and excel at remote work, helping to foster an inclusive team culture
We require a link or pdf to a strong design portfolio that demonstrates:
Proven product design successes with substantial business impact on a consumer-facing or community-oriented product
A detail-oriented care for your craft and ability to work in systems
Your ability to navigate different fidelities of a project from early concept work to higher fidelity UX/UI execution in the final product
A pursuit of deeper understanding: findings, discoveries, insights or explorations that have allowed you to explore different paths toward an optimal solution
In your cover letter, let us know why you want to work at Medium, what stood out to you from the job description, and why you think you are a good fit for this role.

Benefits

In addition to the new skills you'll pick up, here's what else you'll enjoy by working at Medium:
Working with a fully distributed team: We’re fully remote and have teammates across the U.S. & France
Healthcare benefits covered at 100% for employees and 70% for dependents
Generous parental leave policy & tutoring services through Outschool
Mental health support through Talkspace
Financial wellness support through Northstar
Stipends for wellness, co-working, professional development, wifi and a one-time home office bonus
Unlimited PTO and standard company holidays
A Medium subscription

About Medium
At Medium, we foster an inclusive, supportive, fun, and challenging team environment. We value having a team that is made up of a diverse set of backgrounds and respect the healthy expression of diverse opinions. We embrace experimentation and the examination of all kinds of ideas through reasoning and testing. Come join us as we continue to change the world of digital media.

Medium is an equal opportunity employer.
Read about our story here.

Bitwarden empowers enterprises, developers, and individuals to securely store and share sensitive data. With a transparent, open-source approach to password management, secrets management, and passwordless and passkey innovations, Bitwarden makes it easy for users to extend robust security practices across all online activities. Founded in 2016 with headquarters in Santa Barbara, California, Bitwarden is supported by a passionate global community of security experts and enthusiasts.
As a Senior Front-End Engineer on the UI Foundation team at Bitwarden, you will be responsible for building and maintaining core cross-cutting areas of our codebase, enabling your team and others to build secure, performant, accessible, and user-focused software. The key pillars of our team's strategy include: maintaining a shared UI toolkit for use across all clients, ensuring that our teams have proper tooling and design documentation needed to succeed, and collaborating closely with design to help bring their visions to life. You will be a key contributor to ensuring the success of this strategy.
We're looking for someone who will thrive in a growing organization with a strong collaborative focus. You will have the opportunity to take ownership over key areas of our product, providing direction for future changes and scoping out work to bring exciting new features to our users while maintaining overall code quality and maintainability.
This is an all-remote team, and we are looking for someone based in the U.S.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Become an expert and authority on our front-end codebase and our design system
Participate in hands-on development of new components, building and updating components to support new features
Collaborating with designers to implement our design system
Support other teams in the organization with guidance and direction on front-end best practices
Participate in code reviews, learning and spreading knowledge
Occasionally contribute bug fixes submitted by the user community
WHAT YOU BRING TO BITWARDEN
Demonstrated experience using modern frontend frameworks (with a preference towards Angular)
Demonstrated expertise in building reusable libraries
Experience implementing designs from Figma or similar tools
Familiarity with Storybook or another similar tool
Familiarity with web content accessibility guidelines (WCAG) and implementing accessible experiences
Familiarity with webpack and other build systems
Collaborative and adaptable mindset
Openness and authenticity combined with excellent communication skills
Excitement and enthusiasm for open source and for better internet security
Excellent problem-solving skills – you might not know all the answers, but you know how to find and communicate the solution
WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE INTERVIEW PROCESS
Selected candidates will be invited to schedule an introduction call and potentially progress through the following stages:
Interview with hiring manager
Panel interview with other engineers
Reference calls
A FEW REASONS TO WORK WITH US
Our user community loves us and we love them. Come to work each day with a sense of purpose as we bring a more secure internet experience to everyone from our friends and family to the world's largest organizations.
Become an expert. You'll get immersed in the prominent technology markets of security and open source software.
We are dedicated to building a diverse and talented team. Work remotely with motivated and supportive team members across the world and take part in productive and fun meetups.
Learn and grow. Take on new challenges with the support of your team, and join our #growth-club to continue personal and professional development.
We recognize and understand that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If you don't meet 100% of the qualifications for the position, you should still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.

In the United States, the starting base compensation range for this role is $140,000 - $200,000. Actual compensation may vary based on level, relevant experience, and skill set as assessed in the interview process, as well as market data by location. See our careers page for a list of benefits. Please note that compensation outside the U.S. will differ based on the market.

D.A. Davidson Companies is an independent, employee-owned company with a rich history spanning more than 80 years. We are dedicated to conducting our business in accordance with the highest standards of integrity and ethics, and delivering outstanding service to our clients and each other. We support a friendly, open and supportive culture, and encourage candid communication and productive engagement that make our companies and each of us better. Just as we work to improve our clients’ financial well-being, we also work to strengthen local communities—and giving back is one of our core values. You can learn more about our company culture and impact in our latest annual report.

Summary:
D.A. Davidson, an employee-owned Financial Services firm, is seeking an accomplished UX/UI Designer to help lead our team in crafting intuitive and impactful user experiences across our digital products. As a UX/UI Designer, you will leverage your extensive experience and expertise to drive the creation of compelling experiences that enhance the usability and overall satisfaction of our users. You will collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and UX Researchers to design, test, and iterate digital experiences prior to and after launch. You will play a crucial role in driving effective and distinctive digital experiences that marry desirability, feasibility, and viability.

Qualifications:
Required:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Interaction Design, UI/UX Design, Web Product Design, Web Development or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background.
6+ years of experience in a related field, with at least 3 years of experience in user experience, interaction design, product innovation and research in a product development team required.
Proven experience in leading projects and contributing to the development of multiple shipped digital products.
Ability to develop processes and approaches for tackling design problems, anticipating challenges, and uncovering quality solutions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain rationale for design decisions and clarify success metrics.
Demonstrated application of human-centered design with a keen understanding of business and technical impacts on digital design.
Self-directed and proactive, with a passion for driving progress and making meaningful contributions.

Overview:
Lynker Corporation is a leading provider of innovative solutions in weather and climate science. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for innovation, Lynker leverages cutting-edge technologies and scientific expertise to support the creation and delivery of improved operational weather forecasts.

As part of our ongoing growth and expansion, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced UI and UX Developer to join our growing team. This position is contingent on winning the contract and will officially be staffed upon contract award.
Responsibilities:
Duties of the UI and UX Developer will include the following:

Design high-quality, responsive user experiences and user interfaces for a portfolio of NOAA’s websites and web applications
Take full ownership of projects from design to implementation and deployment
Collaborate with project teams to create interfaces based on user requirements, feedback and best practices following an industry standard product development process
Develop prototype user experiences with wireframes
Develop and maintain applications based on UI guidelines to ensure pages are standards-compliant, universally accessible, cross-browser compatible and maintain visual consistency in accordance with brand standards
Collaborate with UI/UX team members to stay up-to-date with new and emerging web design trends and technologies
Participate in research, planning, and brainstorming with development and project teams

Qualifications:
The UI and UX Developer selected should have the following:

3+ years of experience in interactive or front-end web design
Expertise in CSS and preprocessors (SASS, LESS, etc.)
Expertise in standard UX software such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma and InVision
Working knowledge of JavaScript and HTML
Understand the user experience and how to analyze and test usability
A great portfolio that demonstrates your design and web development skills
Mobile and responsive design experience
Team player with proven ability to work with client and project teams
You will be expected to complete an on-site and/or take home assignment for this position

The Ideal UI and UX Developer will have the following:

Familiarity with Agile
Experience with frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue
Experience with ParcelJS, Webpack or other web application bundlers
Experience with static site generators like Middleman, Jekyll or Hugo
Experience with Atlassian products
Experience with a design system
An understanding of 508 Compliance
OpenSource contributions and StackOverflow reputation is a plus

About Lynker

Lynker is a growing, employee owned, small business, specializing in professional, scientific and technical services. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in hydrology/water sciences, geospatial analysis, information technology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.

We focus on putting the right people in the right place to be effective. And having the right people is critical for success. Our streamlined organization enables and empowers our talented professionals to tackle our customers' scientific and technical priorities – creatively and effectively.

Lynker offers a team-oriented work environment, and the opportunity to work in a culture of exceptionally skilled professionals who embrace sound science and creative solutions. Lynker's benefits include the following:
Comprehensive healthcare for the employee at no monthly cost
Healthcare benefit covers medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision
Personal Time Off (PTO) Policy plus paid holidays
Highly competitive compensation plan regularly calibrated against industry and location benchmarks
401(k) retirement plan with company-matching
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) – we're all company owners!
Flexible spending accounts
Employee assistance program (EAP)
Short- and long-term disability insurance
Life and accident insurance
Tuition assistance/Training/Workforce improvement reimbursement per year
Spot bonuses for exceptional performance
Annual Employee Recognition Awards with bonuses
Employee Referral Program
Free centralized, self-directed Learning Management System to learn at your own pace
Personalized career growth plans for every employee
Lynker is an E-Verify employer.

Lynker is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions based on merit, qualifications, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local laws.

JR31831
Job Posting Date
02-10-2025
Teams
Engineering
Work Type
Remote
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.
Instant streaming is a core part of Netflix's strategy for the future. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008. Since then, we have continued to grow the number of Netflix-enabled devices across Smart TVs, Blu-ray players, Streaming sticks, and Operator set-top boxes, now amassing hundreds of unique integrations. Our partnerships include many of the world’s top consumer electronics brands, like Samsung, LG, Amazon, and Roku, as well as many top operators globally.
The Client and Partner Technologies (CPT) organization is chartered with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences and building high-quality products across the partner device ecosystem. The Device Reliability Engineering team is the quality and reliability guardian for Consumer Electronics and Multi Video Programming Devices, focusing on user-impacting issues, including streaming, partner payments, Partner UI, and partner payment fraud.
About the role:
With millions of users streaming Netflix, device reliability is a critical focus area. We want to delight our customers with a service that just works, always. The Device Reliability Team is responsible for post-launch monitoring and supporting our partner’s ports of Netflix on Smart TVs, Blu-ray players, general set-top boxes (e.g., Roku), and MVPD set-top boxes (e.g., satellite and cable boxes).
We are monitoring device health in the field across hundreds of different types of devices. We triage, root cause, and manage to conclude issues as they arise. In addition, we drive learnings from these issues back to the rest of Netflix and work closely with cross-functional teams so we can build more resilient products, improve our processes, and build out better quality features. For more background and details on the team please see this LinkedIn post.
We are looking for a technology leader who would like to join our team and help our partners build and maintain a world-class, highly reliable Netflix solution.
To learn more about the origins of our teams, check out this podcast.
We are confident you can do this job if...
You have experience working on Consumer Embedded devices. An understanding of device security, DRM, or video pipeline is a definite plus.
Demonstrated an analytical approach to large data sets. You are skilled at identifying patterns within large amounts of data.
Exhibit world-class troubleshooting skills, a passion for creating high-quality solutions and applying your skills to new context areas.
You have a proven track record of providing exceptional support through on-call and incident management for business-critical, time-sensitive operations.
You are an expert at developing automation tools for monitoring, deployment, and incident response to ensure efficient and reliable operations.
You conduct or participate in analysis, and influence product policies and features to improve detection and reliability.
Worked on large-scale client-server solutions and have experience reading logs across multiple technology sources.
You are proficient in modern programming and scripting languages such as Java/ Python/ Javascript/Node.js.
Knowledge of SQL, data analytics, and data visualization.
You have 5+ years of relevant experience.
However, we are looking for more than just technical chops. The team is also seeking someone who...
Has a proven track record working with cross-functional teams and driving them towards solving issues.
Understands that proactive, cross-functional communication with internal and external engineering teams, as well as technical leadership, is essential for problem-solving.
Enjoys working side by side with partners on tough problems.
Knows when time must be taken to build tools to solve ongoing problems.
Demonstrates an insatiable curiosity for not just “why,” but “how” and “what.”
Loves pointing to products on the shelf (and in the homes of your friends) to say "I worked on that!"
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000.
Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here.
Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.
We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Job is open for no less than 7 days and will be removed when the position is filled.

At Offchain Labs, we are not just building products — we’re leading a movement.
We are committed to creating a decentralized, secure, and transparent future through blockchain technology. Our mission is to push the boundaries of blockchain innovation and foster a creative, collaborative, and inclusive culture where ideas can come to life. We know that the future of blockchain technology is limitless, and the best way to achieve this is by working with the brightest minds.

We’re looking for thinkers and doers who are eager to embrace new challenges and seek solutions that will push existing boundaries. If you believe in the importance of transparency, trust, and the decentralization of control, and if you’re curious, adaptable, and want to disrupt the status quo, then we want to hear from you.

Why Offchain Labs?

Our team is committed to bridging the gap between the current state of blockchain and its potential. Our flagship product, Arbitrum One, is a dominant force in Ethereum scaling and is trusted by enterprises, developers, and users worldwide. But that’s just the beginning. Our passionate team is constantly building on this success, rolling out innovative tools such as Arbitrum AnyTrust, Arbitrum Orbit, Stylus, BoLD, and Arbitrum Nitro. Offchain Labs also contributes to the Ethereum core protocol with the Prysm consensus client.

Following the successful raising of $3.8M in seed funding in January 2019, as well as $20M in Series A and $100M in Series B funding in 2021, we are looking to expand our team. We invite individuals with a strong interest in blockchain and a talent for approaching problems from unique perspectives to join us in shaping the future of this dynamic field.

We’re looking for a Product Designer to join our team. They will be working closely with the Fullstack Engineering team, focusing on end to end product design with a keen eye for edge cases, usability and strategic impact.
What You'll Do:
Own the Full design lifecycle, from research and wireframing to high fidelity UI and final implementation.
Work closely with engineers and product teams to design intuitive, high quality user experiences.
Anticipate edge cases and complex user flows, ensuring a seamless experience across all touchpoints.
Maintain personal pride in the quality of your designs, striving for polished production ready output.
Think strategically about design decisions, balancing user needs, technical feasibility, and business goals.
What You'll Need:
3+ years of experience in Product Design. Ideally working on complex user-centric interfaces.
Has a strong Portfolio (please submit portfolio in your application)
Expert level proficiency in Figma. Strong design skills with experience in automation, widgets and component based design systems.
Web3 experience is a plus. Understanding of edge cases in decentralized applications is beneficial.
Perks:
Remote-first global workforce + soon to open NY office.
Annual company offsite + team onsites.
Professional reimbursement program (facilitates industry conference attendance, certifications, and more).
Medical, dental & vision coverage (US + some other countries).
401k retirement plan + company match (US only).
Wellness stipend.
Home office set up / ergonomic equipment program.
Attention Offchain Labs Job Seekers:

Please be advised that there has been a rise in fraudulent recruiter activities, particularly within the Web3 space. If you would like to confirm whether someone is an OCL employee or the legitimacy of an offer you received, please email jobs@offchainlabs.com.

At Offchain Labs, we believe that diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are essential to our success. We are committed to building a welcoming and supportive workplace for all employees, regardless of their background or identity. We strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued and has an equal opportunity to succeed and thrive. We encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply and join our team.

Company Description

Founded in 2001, GALLEGOS United is a creatively driven agency born of a unique pedigree, creating marketing communications that help brands find new growth by being attuned to today’s America. GALLEGOS United counts Comcast, California Milk Processor Board (Got Milk?), DoorDash, Dr. Pepper among others as clients. Recognized for its inventive work, the agency is one of the most awarded agencies globally, including being named one of Advertising Age’s Agencies to Watch, and named by AdWeek as Multicultural Agency of the Year. The agency was recognized by EFFIE as one of the Top 10 most effective independent creative agencies

Job Description

We’re seeking a Freelance UX Lead to drive UX strategy, design, and execution for a high-profile digital project. This role requires a hands-on expert who can lead the UX process while balancing the needs of diverse stakeholders. You’ll be responsible for defining and structuring the experience of immersive storytelling and e-commerce sites for both B2C and B2B brands.
As the UX Lead, you’ll partially wear the Product Manager hat, guiding requirements, defining workflows, and ensuring that UX solutions align with business goals. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, developers, and clients to bring concepts to life, using Figma as the primary design tool.
This role is perfect for someone who thrives in dynamic environments, is comfortable working with challenging stakeholders, and enjoys translating complex needs into seamless user experiences.

Responsibilities
UX Strategy & Execution
Lead UX design for immersive storytelling and e-commerce projects, ensuring seamless and engaging user experiences.
Facilitate requirements-gathering workshops to define user needs, business goals, and technical constraints.
Document UX requirements clearly, ensuring alignment between design, development, and client expectations.
Develop wireframes, interactive prototypes, and UX flows in Figma to communicate design concepts effectively.
Create UI animations to enhance interactivity and storytelling elements.
Work closely with UI designers and developers to bring UX concepts to execution.
Stakeholder & Client Collaboration
Navigate complex stakeholder dynamics, ensuring all perspectives are considered while maintaining user-centered design principles.
Present UX concepts persuasively, balancing user needs with business objectives.
Provide process insights and recommendations to optimize workflow efficiency.
Nice-to-Have (But Not Required)
Experience conducting user research or usability testing to validate design decisions.
Familiarity with accessibility standards (WCAG).

Qualifications

7+ years of UX/UI design experience, with a strong focus on immersive storytelling and e-commerce experiences.
Proficiency in Figma for UX/UI design, prototyping, and collaboration.
Experience creating UI animations to enhance engagement and interactivity.
Strong background in B2C and B2B digital experiences.
Proven ability to lead requirements-gathering workshops and translate insights into structured documentation.
Ability to work independently while coordinating with designers, developers, and clients.
Strong communication and problem-solving skills—comfortable working with challenging clients and stakeholders.

Additional Information

Project based, 2-3 months
Why This Role?
Work on a high-impact, high-visibility digital project.
Fully remote with flexible hours.
Opportunity to shape UX strategy while influencing project direction.
Competitive contract rates.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Actual offer may vary by market location, job-related knowledge, skills and experience.

TheGuarantors is a cutting edge fintech company setting the standard in rent coverage with unrivaled insurance products. With a deep understanding of owner, operator, and renter needs, we believe renters deserve better access to the home of their dreams and operators deserve greater protection and growth opportunities. That’s why we’re leveraging our expertise in real estate and using AI-based technology to help operators qualify renters faster while mitigating the risk of rental income loss. With $4B+ in rent and deposits guaranteed, we work with 9 of the country’s top 10 operators and have been named one of Inc. 5000’s fastest-growing companies, one of Forbes’ Best Startup Employers, and one of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500.

The Role
This is a fantastic opportunity to shape our product experience for our wonders and operators, driving innovation and delivering best-in-class product design. You will create both current and future products and services, leveraging your expertise to engage customers and align with our design vision.

What you’ll do
Play a pivotal hands on role in shaping new digital experiences for owner and operator clients at TheGuarantors.
Design intuitive, visually stunning, and data-driven interfaces that empower property owners and operators.
Create exceptional experiences and tools that balance aesthetics, usability, and functionality.
Directly impact the user journey by enhancing how clients manage risk and streamline their operations.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure a high level of craftsmanship in design efforts.
Drive innovation and contribute to future product ideation and design, shaping the direction of our offerings.

What We Are Looking For:
5+ years of Product Design experience
Proven experience designing for B2B SaaS platforms or fintech/proptech industries
Experience in contributing to high-quality, scalable design systems
Strong proficiency in modern design tools
Ability and desire to solve complex product design problems
Self-motivated with impeccable execution for all aspects of design, from conceptual thinking to UI, visual design with a portfolio showcasing visually compelling interfaces.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize and present findings, and articulate design rationale
Experience working in an agile and highly iterative, collaborative environment
Excellent written, verbal, and communication skills with the ability to present

Nice to Have:
Experience with data visualization and designing for complex, multi-user platforms.
Familiarity with prototyping and motion design tools.
Experience in mentoring or leading UI/UX designers.
Understanding of property management, real estate, or fintech industries is a plus.

Benefits
Opportunities to make an impact within a fast growing company
Medical, dental, & vision insurance, beginning day one
Health savings account with employer contribution
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Flexible working hours
401(k)
Paid parental leave
Company sponsored short and long term disability
Flexible spending accounts (healthcare, dependent care, commuter)
Base Salary
The base salary range is between $150,000 - $180,000 annually.
Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, location and current market data and may vary from the range above.

Stay in Touch
Does this role not quite match your skills, but you’re still interested in what we're doing? Stay In Touch and apply to our Dream Job to be one of the first to hear about future opportunities!
TheGuarantors is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive environment for all.

desc:
The Motley Fool serves over 600k paying subscribers in the US, helping them become smarter, happier, and richer. Our team has rapidly enhanced our technological and product capabilities over the last 15 months, and now we're looking for a Contract Principal Designer to guide and elevate the user experience for Fool.com and related digital products.
You will work alongside product managers and engineering leads in an empowered product team, ensuring that customer value, business viability, and technical feasibility are aligned with world-class UX/UI design.
We're anticipating 20-40 hours per week (depending on the freelancer's schedule) for at least 6 months. This role is flexible and 100% remote, however, applicants must reside in the United States for consideration.

About The Motley Fool
We're a purpose-driven financial services company, dedicated to democratizing investing knowledge. We believe in continuous learning, fast iteration, and empowering teams to do their best work. As a Contract Principal Designer, you'll be part of a cross-functional group that leverages modern tools to build intuitive, engaging, and scalable experiences for our users. The Motley Fool is a place where you can do your best work surrounded by people who enthusiastically support your success.
What would you do in this role?
Consult on the Design Vision & Strategy
Own and articulate the user experience strategy for Fool.com's public-facing site and related products, ensuring a consistent, delightful user journey.
Collaborate with product managers and engineering leads to align design work with broader product and business goals, following product team principles (value, usability, feasibility).
Drive User Centric Design and Design Thinking
Conduct user research, stakeholder interviews, and usability testing to gather insights and validate design decisions.
Iterate quickly on design concepts, leveraging rapid feedback loops, user testing and continuous discovery.
Consult on End-to-End Design Execution
Partner with developers to overhaul the current Fool.com site to NextJs, ensuring design consistency and an optimal user experience.
Work with front-end teams to create high-fidelity designs, interaction flows with detailed definitions for development handoff.
Establish and Maintain Design Systems
Develop and maintain a robust design system, ensuring brand consistency across all platforms and products.
Advocate for design best practices and accessibility, guiding teams on typography, color systems, and responsive layouts.
Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration
Collaborate with product managers, developers, cloud operations, cybersecurity, and more to deliver high-quality, user-centric solutions.
Coach and mentor other designers, building a culture of learning, experimentation, and continuous improvement.
Champion Data-Informed Decisions
Use analytics, A/B testing, and other data-driven methods to iterate on design solutions.
Communicate findings and design rationale effectively to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across teams.
What do you need to apply?
8+ Years of Product/UX Design Experience
Proven background leading design initiatives for consumer-facing web or mobile products.
Mastery of Design Tools & Methods
Expert knowledge of industry-standard design software and prototyping tools (Figma).
Strong understanding of responsive design principles, information architecture, and visual hierarchy.
User-Centered Mindset
Experience with user research, usability testing, and design thinking methodologies to uncover user needs and pain points.
Strong Collaboration and Leadership Skills
Track record of working in a cross-functional product team (PM + Design + Engineering).
Ability to champion design solutions with clarity and data-backed reasoning.
Understanding of Front-End Ecosystems
Familiarity with modern front-end frameworks (e.g., NextJs, React, or VueJs) and design constraints of each.
Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript to effectively communicate with engineering teams.
Excellent Communication & Storytelling
Ability to present concepts, facilitate workshops, and build consensus with diverse stakeholders.
Curiosity for AI & Emerging Technologies
Interest in leveraging AI-driven design tools, automation, and machine learning insights to enhance user experiences and streamline design workflows.
It's even better if you had…
Experience leading or contributing to complex platform migrations (e.g., from VueJs to NextJs).
Familiarity with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude etc.) to inform design decisions.
Background in financial services, fintech, or content-driven products.
Working knowledge of testing frameworks (Playwright, Cypress) and accessibility guidelines (WCAG).
By applying on this site, you acknowledge that The Motley Fool will be collecting the personal data you provide for our recruiting purposes. Please see our Applicant Privacy Notice for additional information about how we process, transfer, and store your data, including where that data is stored, and about any additional privacy rights you may have based on your jurisdiction.

About iBusiness Funding

iBusiness Funding is a leader in providing innovative Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions for banks and lenders, with a specialization in SBA lending. We build scalable lending platforms that streamline the business lending process, allowing lenders to efficiently deliver capital to small and medium-sized businesses.

To date, we’ve processed over $7 billion in SBA loans and handle more than 1,000 business loan applications daily. Our team is driven by our core values of innovation, integrity, enjoyment, and family.

As a top five SBA 7(a) preferred lender, our parent company offers SBA express and small loan capabilities. Join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the finance industry and empowering businesses to thrive!

**This is a remote position that may be performed from your home.**

Role Overview:

As the Director of UX, you will lead the charge in designing, managing, and enhancing the user experience across our platform. You will blend hands-on design work with leadership, guiding a talented team of designers while collaborating closely with product managers and engineers in a fast-paced, agile environment.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Leadership: Define and drive the UX vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with product and business goals.

History & Mission
Founded in 2014 in Montreal, Canada, Paper is an educational support system (ESS) for K-12 schools across North America. The company’s fundamental mission is to bridge the gap between what schools provide and what students need to succeed. As a personalized learning platform that empowers all students and maximizes their lifetime potential, Paper’s team of vetted and trained educators offer 1:1 online tutoring for any subject, at any time. Students communicate with these educators about their challenges with classwork and solve their problems collaboratively via a rich, text-based environment.
Paper closed its first public school deal in 2018 and has subsequently signed numerous districts onto its platform. In 2019, Paper generated $1 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR) and exited 2022 with $68 million ARR. Paper has grown from 174 employees in 2019 to over 1800 employees currently (split between FTEs and Part-time Tutors).
Today, Paper serves more than 3 million students from over 400+ school districts across 40 US States and Canada with headquarters in both Montreal and Las Vegas. Paper integrates directly into a school district’s existing IT infrastructure and leverages technology to equip all students with personalized learning to maximize outcomes.
Solutions
The Paper ESS is comprised of three key solutions allowing each student to build a learning profile that is informed by data collected throughout their academic journey and augmented by the data of Paper’s growing network of learners across North America. Since its founding, the company has been optimizing its product and has evolved into a per-student annual subscription license that targets public school districts as the primary customer.
1. Personalized Tutoring: Paper provides students with 24/7 access to tutoring in any subject, anytime from anywhere. Various communication features (including text, voice notes, and a virtual whiteboard) ensure students have an experience that best suits their preferred learning style. Support is available in English, Spanish, French, & Mandarin.

2. Practice Center: Paper provides practice tools that support in-class and at-home academic practice in engaging formats that focus on their zone of proximal development, including Math, English, Language, Arts, and Reading fluency.
3. College and Career Readiness: Paper provides students with resources that prepare them for life after high school, including academic planning, college and career readiness tools, work-based learning, and micro-credentials. Paper helps ensure every student’s education leads to a successful career outcome, whether through a degree or going into the workforce.
Additionally, the company’s platform delivers a portal for teachers and administrators to gain data and analysis of a student’s competencies and progress.
Financial Sponsors
Since its founding, Paper has raised over $390 million in financing. In 2016, the company received $1.6 million in seed funding, led by Birchmere Ventures, followed by $7.5 million in a Series A round led by Reach Capital and Bullpen Capital, with participation from Google. In 2020, Paper raised an additional $11 million in funding led by Framework Venture Partners and Salesforce. In June of 2021, the company closed a $100 million Series C led by IVP, and the following year in 2022, Paper closed a Series D financing of $270 million led by Softbank and Sapphire Ventures.
The Opportunity
Paper grew at an incredibly rapid pace over the COVID-19 pandemic when the world experienced a sudden shift away from the classroom and forced rapid adoption of online learning, education, and virtual tutoring. Post-pandemic, with the democratization of Generative AI and the shift in federal funding, Paper is refocusing its efforts towards a path to profitability.

Our Story: Founded in 2011, MFour is a fast-growing data and analytics technology company "democratizing" consumer insights. Named a 2023, "top 25 L.A. tech companies to watch," by Built In, we've created a SaaS ecosystem, giving businesses access to united shopper behavior + opinion data that uncovers the whos, whats, whys, whens and wheres behind consumers in ways never before possible. We help 25% of the Fortune 100 plus organizations of all sizes make product, brand and advertising decisions.
Our Product: Using the nation's most downloaded, highest-rated, and only Apple-approved app & web data collection and survey app (Surveys On The Go®), MFour is the only consumer market research company that guarantees real, validated responses for every survey, giving businesses the data and insights they need to make impactful decisions.
From validated opinion and behavior trackers to advertising exposure measurement MFour is trusted by hundreds of leading.
Our Goal: To eliminate the unknown (data blind spots) within market research in a way that recognizes a consumer's right to privacy – so marketers can make better decisions about new and existing products, advertising choices and competitive positioning. MFour is trusted by hundreds of leading brands, including Google, Microsoft, Samsung, Walmart, Disney, Spotify, and Lowe's.
Our Core Values: Simplicity, Humility, Quality, Consistency, and Innovation.
Your Mission
MFour is seeking a Front-End Engineer with a passion for developing sleek and user-friendly interfaces. As part of our team of seasoned engineers, you will contribute to the development of a SaaS platform utilizing the latest and greatest concepts and technologies. Our goal transcends mere product development; we aim to craft a user experience that empowers our clients to make informed decisions.
This role offers the chance to:
Master your craft: Deepen your expertise in React, Next.js, and advanced front-end techniques.
Make a real impact: Your work will directly shape the user experience for a product used by leading brands.
Collaborate with experts: Work alongside talented engineers, designers, and product managers.
Push the boundaries: Explore and implement innovative UI solutions to solve complex challenges
Key Responsibilities:
Architect and develop complex user interfaces using React, Next.js, and state management libraries (e.g., MobX).
Optimize UI performance through techniques like code splitting, lazy loading, and efficient rendering.
Implement robust testing strategies using Jest and React Testing Library to ensure code quality and prevent regressions.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers to translate Figma prototypes and design specifications into pixel-perfect React components.
Contribute to and maintain our component library and style guide to ensure UI consistency and scalability.
Participate in technical discussions and contribute to architectural decisions related to front-end development.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in front-end frameworks, libraries, and UI design trends.

Qualifications That Set You Apart
5+ years of experience developing production-ready web applications using React and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of UI design principles, including usability, accessibility, and responsive design.
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and CSS-in-JS solutions (e.g., styled components, Emotion).
Experience with front-end build tools (e.g., Webpack, Babel).
Familiarity with Git and version control best practices.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Passion for building beautiful, high-performance, and user-centric interfaces.
Bonus Points:
Experience with GraphQL and Apollo Client.
Familiarity with data visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Chart.js).
Contributions to open-source projects.

In Return for Your Dedication, We Offer:
Health benefits
Top-tier health benefits include; medical, dental, vision, LTD, and life insurance
Mental health benefits
Work-life balance
Unlimited PTO
Hybrid model

Location: Lexington, KY

About KiZAN

We make technology personal!
KiZAN is an Industry leading Microsoft Professional Services and Managed Services Provider supporting Regional, National and Global clients. We personalize technology by sparking passion, fueling purpose, and building connections.
Here at KiZAN, we are one team, we support each other and take the initiative to solve problems. We are fully committed to the direction chosen and always support our Mission. Being a part of KiZAN means that we win together, we create an inclusive atmosphere where everyone feels accepted, a sense of purpose, and we embrace collaboration.
About the Role
We are seeking a Senior Power Platform Developer to design, develop, and maintain scalable business solutions using Microsoft Power Platform. This role will focus on building custom applications, automating workflows, and optimizing data-driven processes while integrating with SharePoint, Power Apps, Power Pages, and Dataverse. The ideal candidate is a skilled problem-solver with a strong technical background in low-code development, governance best practices, and enterprise solution architecture.
Key Responsibilities:
Solution Development: Design and develop Power Apps (Canvas & Model-driven), Power Pages, and Power Automate flows to streamline business processes.
SharePoint Integration: Extend SharePoint capabilities through Power Platform by building custom solutions, forms, and workflows.
Dataverse & Data Management: Architect scalable data models in Dataverse, integrate external data sources, and optimize data security and governance.
Automation & Efficiency: Build and optimize Power Automate flows to automate business processes and integrations with other Microsoft and third-party services.
Customization & Extensibility: Utilize Power FX, JavaScript, and Power Automate expressions to create dynamic and user-friendly solutions.
Security & Governance: Implement best practices for Power Platform governance, including security roles, data loss prevention (DLP), and application lifecycle management (ALM).
Performance Optimization: Analyze existing solutions and improve efficiency, responsiveness, and scalability.
Collaboration & Leadership: Work closely with business stakeholders, UI/UX designers, and IT teams to gather requirements and implement solutions that drive business value.
Training & Documentation: Provide technical guidance, create documentation, and support knowledge transfer for citizen developers and end-users.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Pages, and Dataverse).
Expertise in SharePoint Online, including custom forms, data integration, and Power Platform solutions.
Strong experience with Dataverse, SQL, Azure Functions, and API integrations.
Proficiency in Power FX, JavaScript, and JSON for extending app functionality.
Knowledge of Power Platform governance, ALM, security, and administration best practices.
Experience working with Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365, and Azure services.
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions using agile methodologies.
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to work independently, and mentor junior developers.
Preferred Qualifications:
Microsoft Power Platform Certifications (PL-100, PL-200, PL-400, or equivalent).
Experience with AI Builder, Power Virtual Agents, and Power BI.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for Power Platform (CI/CD, source control, and pipelines).
Why Join Us?
Work on cutting-edge Power Platform projects with a team of experts.
A culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Competitive salary, flexible work options, and career growth opportunities.

Comprehensive health benefits include - medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible spending account, paid
sick leave and paid time off, parental leave, quarterly performance bonus, training, career growth and

At Ziply Fiber, our mission is to elevate the connected lives of our communities every day. We are
delivering the fastest home internet in the Northwest, with a focus on areas traditionally underserved by
mainstream internet companies. And as our state-of-the-art fiber network expands in WA, OR, ID and MT,
so does our need for team members who can help us grow and realize our goals.


We may be building internet, but we are reaching real people. We strive to build relationships and provide
customers and communities with refreshingly great experiences.


We emphasize our values in all our interactions:


Genuinely Caring: Our customers and colleagues are people, and quite possibly our neighbors. We put
ourselves in their shoes and give them our full attention.


Empowering You: We empower our customers to choose the products that best meet their needs, and
we support our employees to implement solutions that elevate the experiences of our customers and
coworkers.


Innovation and Improvement: We always look for ways to make the experiences of our customers –
and each other – better.


Earning Your Trust: We earn trust by communicating simply and transparently as real people, not as a
corporation.


Job Summary
The RPA & Automation Developer will design, develop, and deploy automation solutions using tools like
RPA (Robotic Process Automation), LLMs (Large Language Models), screen scraping, and scripting to
streamline operations in a Fiber ISP company. This hands-on technical role focuses on building bots,
integrating AI-driven workflows, and maintaining systems to reduce manual effort in areas such as
customer service, network provisioning, billing, and data management.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
The Essential Duties and Responsibilities listed below are a range of duties performed by the employee
and not intended to reflect all duties performed.


1. Automation Development & Deployment
RPA Bot Development:
Design, code, and test RPA bots (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism) to
automate repetitive tasks such as:
Service activation workflows (e.g., automating FTTH provisioning in
OSS/BSS systems).
Billing reconciliation, invoice generation, and payment processing.
Data migration between legacy systems (e.g., CRM updates, network
inventory syncs).
ML Integration:
Collaborate and Implement workflows for automated ticket classification, response
drafting, and sentiment analysis using LLM and ML models developed by ML teams
internally.
Screen Scraping & Data Extraction:
Develop scripts (Python, JavaScript) with tools like Selenium, BeautifulSoup, or
Puppeteer to scrape data from legacy UIs, third-party portals, or public sources (e.g.,
competitor pricing, regulatory filings).
API & System Integration:
Connect automation workflows with internal systems (e.g., network monitoring tools,
billing platforms) via RESTful APIs or middleware.
2. Process Optimization & Maintenance
Monitor and debug automation workflows to ensure reliability (e.g., resolving bot errors due to
UI changes or data mismatches).
Optimize scripts for performance (e.g., reducing runtime by 30%, improving data accuracy).
Update existing automations to align with evolving business rules or regulatory requirements
(e.g., GDPR compliance in customer data handling).
3. Collaboration & Requirements Gathering
Work with cross-functional teams (Network Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to:
Identify automation opportunities (e.g., automating outage alerts, bandwidth usage
reports).
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for bots or AI models.
Document workflows, code, and user guides for transparency and scalability.
4. Technical Innovation
Experiment with emerging tools like intelligent document processing (IDP) for automated
invoice parsing or low-code platforms for rapid prototyping.
Implement predictive maintenance models using ML to forecast network equipment failures.
Explore generative AI for dynamic customer communications (e.g., personalized service
upgrade recommendations).
Performs other duties as required to support the business and evolving organization.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.
Master’s preferred.
Experience:
5+ overall professional experience
2+ years in automation roles, with expertise in RPA, scripting (Python, PowerShell), and
AI/ML.
Certifications (Preferred):
UiPath RPA Developer, Automation Anywhere Certified Advanced RPA Professional,
Python certifications.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Technical: RPA tools, Python/Java, APIs, SQL, NLP, OCR, and data analytics.
RPA tools (Automation Anywhere, Power Automate).
Scripting (Python, JavaScript), SQL, APIs, OCR (e.g., ABBYY).
Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills are required.
Must be thorough and efficient in creating documentation.
Soft Skills:
Problem-solving, attention to detail, and ability to work in Agile/Scrum teams.
Strong communication to explain technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.


Work Authorization
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US for any employer. Sponsorship is not available
for this position.


Physical Requirements
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to
successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Essential and marginal functions may require maintaining the physical condition necessary for bending,
stooping, sitting, walking, or standing for prolonged periods of time; most of the time is spent sitting in a
comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. The employee must occasionally lift and/or
move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision,
color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.


Work Environment
Work is performed in an office setting with exposure to computer screens and requires extensive use of a
computer, keyboard, mouse, and multi-line telephone system. The work is primarily a modern office
setting.


At all times, Ziply Fiber must be your primary employer. Unless otherwise prohibited by law, employees
may not hold outside employment nor be self-employed without obtaining approval in writing from Ziply
Fiber. In holding outside employment or self-employment, employees should ensure that participation
does not conflict with responsibilities to Ziply Fiber or its business interests.


Diverse Workforce / EEO:
Ziply Fiber is an equal opportunity employer. Ziply Fiber will consider all qualified candidates regardless of
race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, and the
presence of a non-job-related handicap or disability or any other legally protected status.


Ziply Fiber requires a pre-employment background check as conditions of employment. Ziply Fiber may
require a pre-employment drug screening.


Ziply Fiber is a drug free workplace.

As a Full-Stack Web Developer, you will contribute to both front and back-end development. This role will primarily involve customized projects for Rock Island Auction Company. Our development team is integral to our business, and we are looking for a proactive programmer eager to make an impact.

Design and implement new user-facing features while enhancing existing ones.
Develop reusable code and libraries for efficient future use.
Ensure UI/UX designs are technically feasible and optimize applications for performance and scalability.
Validate user input before submitting data to the back-end.
Collaborate with team members and stakeholders to define and execute new functionalities.

Lead projects to enhance user experience, ensure brand consistency, and improve application performance.

Excels in a dynamic environment with multiple projects.

desc:
Our mission is to make fashion accessible to all and inspire everyone to dress a little better. We believe e-commerce is in a rut, with brands lost in a decades-long void, lacking innovation, and mindlessly redesigning websites without fixing the real issue: making shopping fun and affordable.
Today, we are the UK's biggest live shopping platform focused on making shopping a joyful, social experience that brings people together and helps everyone level up their style. We've raised an $18m Series A, and we're rapidly growing and looking to hire A-players to build the future of shopping.
More about us:
$18m Series A, TechCrunch
Is Livestream the Future of Second-hand Shopping?
$3m Pre-seed from 2022
Check us out on the UK app store! (other countries are inaccurate until we expand)

Your Mission
As a Senior iOS Engineer on our Sellers team, you'll be crafting exceptional mobile experiences that empower sellers to manage their businesses effectively on the go. Working within an autonomous squad, you'll develop innovative features that help sellers thrive on our platform. You'll be responsible for:
Mobile Architecture: Designing and implementing robust iOS applications using modern frameworks and patterns, ensuring our seller tools are both powerful and intuitive
User Experience: Creating smooth, responsive interfaces that make complex selling tasks feel effortless, with particular attention to animations and multimedia features
Technical Innovation: Building and maintaining high-performance mobile solutions that scale with our growing seller base while maintaining excellent code quality
You must be prepared to jump into a start-up environment; if you're risk-averse this isn't the right place for you. We seek passionate, driven individuals eager to learn quickly, work hard, and help us shape the future.

Technical stack and tools
Our frontend is built with VueJS and TypeScript
On the backend we mainly use NodeJS
Other core technologies include AWS, Express, Vite, and Webpack, NPM, Cypress, GraphQL, and more
On the mobile side, we’re set up in Swift

About you
Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Deep knowledge of the iOS ecosystem and its core frameworks
You’re a whiz with Swift
Strong understanding of mobile architecture patterns and best practices
Experience with animations and multimedia features in iOS
You're an ambitious problem-solver who thrives in fast-paced environments
You communicate technical concepts clearly and work effectively in autonomous teams
You have a keen eye for design and enjoy collaborating with product teams on UX/UI decisions
You're passionate about creating exceptional mobile experiences that empower users

Bonus skills
Experience with E2E Testing Frameworks
Proficiency with GraphQL APIs
Knowledge of Kotlin Multi-Platform (KMP)
Experience with Viper architecture
Understanding of cross-platform development principles

Perks and benefits
We offer a competitive package including:
Competitive base salary
Equity through stock options
Modern tech equipment, including latest Macbook Pro
Remote work options possible
Workspace in London (Canary Wharf), including access to gym

Who we are
As a fast-growing platform, we value innovation, autonomy, and rapid iteration. We believe in empowering our teams to make decisions and move quickly. We're building something unprecedented in the e-commerce space, and we need passionate people who share our vision of making fashion more accessible and enjoyable for everyone.
We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Overview
We are seeking a talented and motivated Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications that meet the needs of our clients. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions and contribute to all phases of the software development lifecycle.
Responsibilities - Please note, not all are required.
Software Architecture & Development: Design, develop, and optimize scalable, high-performance applications using C#, .NET Core, JavaScript (React, Angular, Vue.js).
Technical Leadership: Provide technical guidance, mentorship, and code reviews to the software development team.
Cloud & DevOps: Architect and implement Microsoft Azure-based solutions, utilizing Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines for deployment automation.
Back-End Development: Build and maintain robust APIs using C# (.NET), Node.js, Python, or Java.
Front-End Development: Develop responsive UI components using modern frameworks such as React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.
Database Management: Design and optimize SQL (PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Firebase, Cassandra) databases.
Security & Compliance: Implement security best practices following OWASP guidelines and ensure compliance with GDPR, SOC2 regulations.
Testing & Quality Assurance: Establish and enforce automated testing strategies using Jest, Mocha, Cypress, Selenium.
Collaboration & Agile Methodology: Work closely with product managers, UX designers, and stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated on emerging technologies and advocate for best practices in software engineering.
Experience
5+ years of professional experience in software development.
Expertise in C# (.NET Core, ASP.NET), JavaScript (React, Angular, Vue.js).
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure, DevOps, Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD automation.
Strong experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.
Experience in leading development teams and mentoring engineers.
Solid understanding of software design patterns, microservices architecture, and cloud-native solutions.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in AI & Machine Learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of computer vision technologies (OpenCV, YOLO, TensorFlow Object Detection API).
Understanding of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM templates, Ansible).
Exposure to Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and working in a fast-paced development environment.
Familiarity with event-driven architectures and message queueing (Kafka, RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus).
Join us in shaping the future of technology through innovative software solutions!
We are an EEO!

desc:
ECS is seeking an experienced NIH NIAID Enabling and Advancing Technologies (NEAT) Project Manager (Agile, DevOps) to work remote to provide support for cloud-related application and infrastructure migration and modernization efforts. Ensuring the successful planning and Continuous Delivery/ Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) delivery of software applications and products to business stakeholders. You will lead multiple cross functional teams delivering, DevOps, Business Process Analysis, and Organizational Change Management IT services.
Please Note: This position is contingent upon [contract win].
Project Management:
Prepare cloud migration and modernization schedule and milestones to deliver CI/CD pipelines for all NIAID software applications.
Managing finances and burn rates for the team and augmenting staff as needed.
Analyze complex, multi-task interrelated projects, assess risk and mitigate potential risk to project success.
Prepare and present HHS Enterprise Performance Life Cycle (EPLC) stage gate deliverables and presentations to review boards.
Ensure Agile teams follow web and mobile UI/UX industry best practices, standards and lessons learned.
Agile Delivery:
Foster a thriving and fast-paced work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation.
Facilitate, manage, and maintain Agile artifacts, including user stories, backlogs, and sprint plans.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and Scrum Masters to ensure project alignment with business objectives.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
Conduct and/or participate in formal and informal reviews throughout the development life cycle.
Cloud Migration:
Assist business domain stakeholders with migration "lift and shift" cost-benefit analyses of on-premises vs. cloud-based solutions.
Support cloud-related application and infrastructure modernization efforts at NIAID.
Assisting business domain stakeholders conduct market research on cloud platforms and tools.
Conducting proof-of-concept and pilot projects to evaluate cloud migration and modernization approaches
Salary Range: $115,000-$155,000

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security or related field.
Active Public Trust or higher security clearance.
Minimum 6 years of project management experience, with 5+ years of experience in Agile .NET implementations.
Experience managing technology projects/programs with AWS Cloud products or other cloud technologies, such as Azure highly desired.
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification.
Travel within the Washington DC Metro Area, and CONUS as needed

READ THE DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU APPLY
This project has 10 course with a budget of $200 per course. Each course has 2 handbooks (200-300 pages each) and powerpoint slides of around 340 slides.
The designer will use our templates in InDesign and Powerpoint to convert the 2 handbooks text into designed books and the powerpoint slides text into designed lecture slides. the designer will be required to keep a log of all the images for copyright purposes
The right candidate can be an individual or a company who has the capacity to design 100 - 150 courses in 3 months (at the rate of $200 per course)
You can see an example of a completed designed course in this link https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1xhNt4UTXQ5LDWRuAyBQ33F00r0d4vWg5?usp=sharing
Summary
As a Graphics Designer specializing in Adobe InDesign, you will be instrumental in creating visually compelling designs that align with our brand identity. Reporting to the Creative Director, your role will focus on digital and print design, utilizing core skills such as graphic design, typography, and color management. Your premium skills in art direction and branding will enhance our marketing efforts, while relevant skills in UI design and video editing will support various projects. Join our team to contribute to innovative design solutions that captivate and engage our audience.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $14.00 - $18.00 per hour
Expected hours: 2 – 38 per week
Work Location: Remote
qualifications: ['Microsoft Powerpoint', 'Typography', 'Management', 'Color management', 'UI design', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Video editing', 'Marketing', 'Entry level', 'Art direction', 'Layout design']
